questions.question: So you said number theory, are we literally talking about all the major fields of mathematics?
What non-trivial things does it tell you versus how simply can you express the idea?
Is there something you could say about what are the major problems are with string theory?
Well, to push back on that a little bit, I mean, string theory is just a term, right?
Is that a fair standard to hold before a theory of everything that's trying to unify quantum mechanics and gravity?
What we really know about the world is when we open our eyes, what do you see?
And so you ask a technical question, what are the representations of the rotation group?
Would their math, you know, would they, you know, how much is this really intrinsic to our minds?
Like there's something about physics often that forces you to build a strong intuition about the way reality works, right?
